title: Lots of people are upset that Darius and Garen are strong now
body:
and I'm just happy that we finally have Dota style melee carries like Axe and Juggernaut (literally) in the game. Yeah we already had them but now they can carry the game while building mostly tanky, without honestly being that broken unless you feed them.

I'm pretty happy.

replies.body: It's actually pretty broken that they have tons of damage with no weaknesses, but okay.

"No weaknesses"?

Darius has no mobility whatsoever, can be poked to death with impunity, has barely any cc to speak of (his E is barely usable after the nerfes and in total, brings 2 seconds of slow on his kit) and can be kited by anyone who has any idea what they're doing, not to mention having no innate tank steriods.

Garen is still a bit over the top, but is, on average, slow, vulnerable to poke, lacks consistent sustain and will get killed by any form of % of hp damage. 

Skarner is an issue, but he's squishy and can be cc'd and killed quite easily. He lacks sustain in the jungle and (ironically) lacks consistent damage.

Mord is the easiest champ to kite in all the league and no matter how nasty his Q is, he STILL won't scale into late game like an ADC will. Be careful early game and he becomes a liability late game. 

They do damage BECAUSE they have such clearly defined weaknesses. The only people complaining are the ones who rush in and try to 1v1 them, and then (rightfully) get eaten alive.

It's pretty broken with the winrates they currently have. Garen is on the edge of being fine, imo. His MS nerfs tackled him in the right way, but I think a small nerf towards him is appropriate (but I think the same about Irelia who is probably not getting nerfed anytime soon as she doesn't see play in LCS and few people complain about her atm). 

Darius, however, idk what Riot was thinking. He had the same issue the new Fiora had: Very low winrate on release as players had to find out their optimal play style and build, got a hotfix that buffed them over the whole line and end up being dominant picks.

Funny thing: Mordekaiser had the same issue, with the difference that evne when built inappropriately, he still had a high winrate, so Riot didn't do anything. However, now that he has been "figured out", his winrate is the same as Skarner rework release: Desperately in need of a hotfix nerf.

people need to get off the flash train and learn to use {{summoner:6}} {{summoner:3}}  like if you have 5 exhausts on one team you can literally reduce so much damage taken if the strong/fed enemies are chain exausted

> [{quoted}](name=Nurse Glaceon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iEiloOdP,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-04T06:54:54.882+0000)

The problem with this is that the game is balanced around flash so much.

Isn't Flash the best summoner in the game? What the hell does Ghost have over Flash? It just doesn't make sense to bring Ghost instead of Flash unless your specific champion has insane synergy with it (Hecarim, Olaf). I'll bring Ghost/Flash if I don't want to feed in mid lane, but I'm not going Ghost/Exhaust unless I'm playing Hecarim mid. Which I have never done.
Ghost has a much lower cooldown timer than Flash and will generally get you farther away. A flash user cannot teleport far enough to escape a ghost user unless they flash over a wall.

The thing is, Flash gives you more utility. Ghost is very obvious, as it just sends you faster towards where you were going before. Flash allows you to dodge something, or go Flash->ability to engage instantly. Ghost just doesn't have that utility. Sure, it allows people to maybe just run away fast enough to get away, but it won't be able to do all the fancy tricks that Flash can.

I agree 100%
I was just answering your question of what ghost has over flash. The lower cooldown can actually be a pretty big deal. Especially if you take it on a mid and do a lot of roaming. Flash definitely has more utility, but ghost is just straight up better for specific situations and playstyles.

Both are perfectly viable, but I'll admit that flash is more common for a good reason. And that's the utility you mentioned.

I just hate how they have better early games than Trundle/Mundo and now better late games as well. Literally no reason to play Trundle now unless as a support. Sure Trundle can beat them 1v1 (Darius barely), but they are massively better than him in now in skirmishes/teamfights and with how Darius Q works now it's like Trundle's ult healing but every 5 seconds. 

Also, Mundo just doesn't have a place at all now.
I built a Darius armor/pen tanky and i couldn't die in team fight with his Q health return :P

We always had champions like this, though.

This was Garen back in Season 1.  Or Nasus before his string of nerfs.  Or Darius before his string of nerfs.  There have always been tanky damage dealers who can carry the game.
The entire problem with Garen is that **he can feed** and still snowball. Not feeding the Garen doesn't hamstring him at all.

Honestly, I'm happy that garen and darius are more viable now; however, they need nerfs. I usually don't have an issue with darius but with garen its such a pain in the ass. Two days ago I went 5/1/0 in lane against garen as Riven and the one death i had wasn't even to garen it was to an enemy jinx rocket across the map as I was getting tower dove by a lee sin and garen >.> Basically I destroyed garen in lane and got all the turrets in top lane. Even though I was insanely fed we couldn't close out the game because my bot and midlanes kept getting caught. Once it was late game we lost because garen was unkillable and pretty much did the same amount of damage as i did with just a black cleaver + all tanky items and boots. That is completely ridiculous. Garen as he is right now is pretty much freelo. I use to play garen a lot last season but I've only played him 5 times (i know this number isn't a lot but his win rate and my success with him both prove that he's slightly overturned)  this season after the rework and I won all of the games. Old garen wasn't an issue because he was really hard to kill but fell off and didn't do too much damage. But now new garen does damage and never dies. I don't want garen and darius to be nerfed into oblivion because I find them extremely fun to play against and play as. I just think morde, garen, and darius need some more slaps to the wrists here and there. Like reduce the max ticks on garen's e and I'm not sure what to do about morde and personally I'm fine with darius I usually win against him even when I get countered but its hard to tell so I'll stay out of that one too.

Axe? Melee carry?

Juggernaut building tank?

I'm not a big fan of people who deal as much damage as they soak, and damage really needs to be the last thing a tank should have to be a threat, not the first.

Rito doesn't seem to comprehend this and keeps making tanks that can seal kills, which just results in bruisers or people building full tank because they can't be stopped.

Juggernaut is a stupid archetype, most tanks should be like Amumu or Malphite, their threat is their initiation, not the fact that their initiation also halves the whole team's HP. That's what the AP nuker is supposed to be there for.

Tanks like Volibear, Shyvana or tanky bruisers are stupid, either large hard AoE CC or spammable CC should be their threat, not gobs of magic damage or spammable percent max HP damage.

A tank whose team is ahead should still get 1v1'd by an AD carry lategame, not vice versa.
Axe in dota has no sustain and low hp, so he s killable. Dari and Garen are not.
*coughing
How about base stats?

He's got high base HP and average growth. 

Sustain in Dota is mostly regen based. Axe gets regen from stat gain and a good amount of his core items. It should also be noted that since most of his consistent damage is in his passive, he doesn't typically build damage items that don't also give durability.
I agree personally I haven't seen anything to me that shows them being out of hand unless fed.

I've been playing Quinn, Kayle, and Vladimir top and I find it possible to lane against Garen and Darius without getting completely rekt. They're not completely broken, I think. When patch 5.16 first came out, I thought they were but eventually I found a way to deal with them.
I find the changes to be a bit overtuned but still good honestly.It's nice to have strong bruiser you need to deal with.
